page.title: 03HIGH STREET, SWADLINCOTE
page.content: In{1984 High St.}a busy,narrow street, awkward for pedestrians and traffic alike, was{pedestrianised}.In 1985 a survey was carried out by pupils of {St.George's C.E.School,Church Gresley to discover shopper's feeling's about the new-look{High St.}Of the people questioned,{36%}lived in Swad. the others in surrounding villages.{83%}do their main shopping in Swad., local people walking into town,others coming by car.Only{14%}use the buses. There is a{car park}at either end of{High St & some traffic is allowed for access to premises.The street has been paved with benches at intervals & some tree planting.Most shoppers{(89%)}were con- cerned that traffic was not completely banned during the daytime.The changes were welcomed by{97%}of shoppers who much prefer going shopping today than before pedestrianisation.
